title: API key

subtitle.text5: on their status. Here you can generate and manage the API keys to be used to authenticate the organisation's requests.

error-fecth-api-keys: The list of API keys could not be retrieved
copy-the-api-key: To enable integration, copy the code and insert it into the organisation's proprietary platform.
view-groups-id-message: If you need to change them, generate a new API key and replace the secret in the organisation's platform. Then, lock and delete this API key.
block-warning1: If you lock {{apiKeyName}}, any request made through this API key will fail.
block-warning2: You can activate it again at any time.
rotate-warning1: By rotating {{apiKeyName}}, you deactivate the existing API key and generate a new one, with the same attributes.
rotate-warning2: After you have entered the new API key into the organisation's platform, lock and delete the rotated version.
enable-warning: If you activate the API key {{apiKeyName}}, it can be used again. You can lock it again at any time.
delete-warning: If you permanently delete the API key {{apiKeyName}}, it cannot be activated and used again.
copy-api-key-info: Copy the code and enter it in the organisation's platform
empty-message: No API key has been generated for this organisation yet.

new-api-key.page-description: SEND generated the API key code. Now, enter an identifying name and assign it to one or more groups.
new-api-key.form-error-name: Define a name for the API key
new-api-key.form-label-groups: Choose the groups to assign the API key to
